Fix: Prevent mobile crash by limiting will-change to hover devices

will-change: transform creates GPU compositor layers for each element.
On mobile devices with limited GPU memory, this caused crashes when
scrolling back to the Portfolio section. Now only applied on devices
that support hover, where the optimization is actually useful.

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Remove GPU layer forcing from service images for iOS stability

translateZ\(0\) and backface-visibility: hidden were creating separate
GPU compositor layers for each service image. On iOS Safari with its
strict GPU memory limits, this combined with the Three.js Canvas was
causing crashes when scrolling past the second service card.

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Disable WebGL Canvas on iOS to prevent crashes

iOS Safari has strict GPU memory limits \(~100-200MB\). The site had two
WebGL Canvas elements \(LandingPage with complex glass materials,
TransitionPage\) which exceeded these limits, causing crashes when
scrolling.

Now detects iOS devices and renders simple HTML fallbacks instead of
WebGL content. Desktop and Android devices still get the full 3D
experience.

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Prevent iOS crash on fast scroll to Portfolio

When scrolling fast on iOS, all sections loaded simultaneously,
exceeding Safari''s memory limits and causing page reloads.

Changes:
- Add UnmountableSection that completely unmounts children when
  scrolled past \(frees GPU memory from WebGL canvases\)
- Reduce LazySection rootMargin on iOS \(50-150px vs 200-400px\)
  to prevent loading everything at once during fast scroll
- Add LazyImage component for Portfolio that only loads images
  when they enter viewport on iOS
- iOS detection shared across components for consistent behavior

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
